arm_group.description: Active drug given through PECBLOCK in these patients.
Placebo drug given through PECBLOCK in these patients

brief_summary.textblock:
Pain after breast cancer surgery could be severe and about 1/3 of patients will develop
      chronic pain. The PECBLOCK is the injection of local anesthetics between the two pectoral
      muscles to block pectoral nerves and intercostal nerves innervating the breast. The aim of
      this study is to evaluate the efficacy of the PECBLOCK performed under echoguidance in minor
      and major breast surgery. The prevention of chronic pain following surgery will also be
      evaluated.

clinical_study.brief_title: PECBLOCK for the Treatment of Pain After Breast Surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  women aged 18-85 yrs old

          -  patients ASA status I-IV

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  refusal of the PECBLOCK

          -  allergy to a drug used in the protocol (local anesthetic)

          -  patients with chronic pain before the surgery

clinical_study.official_title: The Pectoral Nerve Block (PECBLOCK) for the Treatment of Pain After Breast Cancer Surgery.

other_outcome.description: When surgery is over, 1-2 h on average depending if it is a tumorectomy or a mastectomy, the total sufentanil consumption in micrograms during surgery is recorded.
other_outcome.time_frame: at the end of surgery (1-2 h on average)

other_outcome.description: Cardiovascular collapse, anaphylactic shock, hematoma, bleeding..?

authority: France: Committee for the Protection of Personnes

primary_outcome.description: Using a 0-10 verbal numerical scale where 0 is no pain and 10 the worst pain imaginable
primary_outcome.measure: Pain score at rest in the recovery room
primary_outcome.time_frame: 30 min after entering the recovery room or just before morphine administration if needed
